name: BACKUP - 281125 - Firm DEMO SSO with HTML Matter Email - Andy

parameters.subject: =Hi, your call with Leonard was too short.
parameters.bodyContent:
=

Hi {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }},

Unfortunately, our call about your matter was too short for me to capture what I needed.

Please call back here to restart the conversation.

Thanks,
Leonard

googleApi.name: Google Service Account - Edu account Oct 8th

parameters.subject: =Hi, {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }} here is the summary of our conversation
parameters.bodyContent:
=

Hi {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }},

Here’s your meeting summary based on the conversation with Leonard:

{{ $json.matter.heading }}
D1 Name of client – this will be publishable. If you cannot reveal the client’s name, give a general description.
{{ $json.matter.D1.client_name }}
D2 Summary of matter and your department's role – Please say why this matter was important. Also, tell us exactly what role your department played.
{{ $json.matter.D2.formatted_output }}
D3 Matter value – include currency and amount in figures
{{ $json.matter.D3.formatted_output }}
D4 Is this a cross-border matter? If yes, please indicate the jurisdictions involved.
{{ $json.matter.D4.formatted_output }}
D5 Lead lawyer
{{ $json.matter.D5.formatted_output }}
D6 Other team members
{{ $json.matter.D6.formatted_output }}
D7 Other firms advising on the matter and their role(s)
{{ $json.matter.D7.formatted_output }}
D8 Date of completion or current status
{{ $json.matter.D8.formatted_output }}
D9 Other information about this matter – e.g. link to press coverage
{{ $json.matter.D9.formatted_output }}

That’s everything for now — hope it was helpful. If you’d like to log another matter straight away, you can do it here.

– Leonard

transcript.message: Hi Andy, how are you doing?
Yeah, good thanks.
May I ask would you like to discuss a new matter or an existing matter?
New matter.

tool_results.result_value: Background task completed: {"original_tool_request_id": "start_c346779aa7f64ce3a5c30bb1ab06c3a6", "tool_result": {"tool_name": "start", "result_value": "{\"conversation_history\":\"Andy Batty, whose email is andy@legalengine.co.uk, currently operates within the M&A environment, focusing on transactions that include reviewing warranty checks 18 years post-merger, a role also tied to the Mars Wrigley acquisition. Historically, Andy also held specializations in IP from the Cork Island office and in Employment Legal practice within the Litigation department in London. Andy has frequently encountered technical difficulties during calls, such as client disconnections, agent failures, and 404 errors.\\n\\nA primary subject of Andy's recent work is a restructuring project for the client Mars Chocolate, which originally commenced in March 2024. This matter, initially reported as completed on July 12, 2025, and previously noted as Mars' largest restructuring for efficiency and automation, tracking a 23.61% cost reduction valued at 426,411 euros, has since reopened and is now considered currently ongoing. The updated value for this specific Mars Chocolate restructuring matter is EUR 500,000. A notable success of this cross-border project, which involves internal HR teams across Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the United Kingdom, and France, has been its ability to avoid litigation from unions, particularly in France. The legal team is led by Lee Curtis, an HR practice group lawyer based in Paris, supported by Pierre Belviad from HR in Berlin and Jurgen Klinsmann from HR in Amsterdam. No other law firms are reported to be involved. While there was no explicit determination of confidentiality in the latest conversation, previous information indicated it was publishable and non-confidential. Andy had previously suggested \\\"Chocolate Weekly podcast\\\" and \\\"FMCG Global website\\\" as potential press coverage avenues using the search term \\\"mass chocolate restructuring.\\\"\\n\\nAnother significant matter is the \\\"Cumulus\\\" Intellectual Property (IP) case for Mars Chocolate, identified by Conversation ID `conv_2401ka3rrpftfq0vybfv7k9r0rvs`. This case, concerning Mars' new product and tagline \\\"it's lighter than ordinary chocolate,\\\" addressed critical IP issues and claim power, particularly regarding potential conflict with Mars' existing \\\"Maltesers\\\" brand. It commenced on June 7, 2023, and was officially closed and completed on November 11, 2025, as confirmed by Andy on November 15, 2025. This domestic UK, non-cross-border matter has a final value of \u00a3825,000, an increase from an earlier reported \u00a3725,000. The lead lawyer for this non-confidential, publishable matter was updated to Lucy Batty (IP, Sandhurst), with Jessica Simpson (IP, London) assisting. Andy Batty himself was initially the lead while specializing in IP from the Cork Island office. Fergal Stump and Fred West are no longer involved, and no other law firms were reported. No direct press coverage has been reported for \\\"Cumulus\\\" IP.\\n\\nAndy was also involved in the Mars acquisition of Wrigley, a Chambers submission that was a non-confidential, publishable, and precedent-setting domestic UK matter, not cross-border, valued at \u00a365,000 euros. Commencing on February 1, 2025, and completing three months later, this deal was recognized for its magnitude and novel synergies identified between gum and chocolate. Peter Clark (M&A, Slough) served as the lead lawyer, supported by Simon Sinek (M&A, London) and Leigh Boner (Human Resources, Columbia). No other law firms participated. Extensive press coverage for this acquisition exists across publications like Food Dive, Family Business Magazine, FoodBev Media, Courthouse News Service, PR Newswire, and SEC filings.\\n\\nAndy's recent work over the past 12 months also includes updating an existing Chambers submission for \\\"HMRC\\\" for client Argos Limited, related to \\\"Massive sales growth.\\\" This non-confidential, publishable matter, valued at \u00a340,000, ran from June 8, 2025, to July 7, 2025, with Andy Batty as the lead lawyer and no other team members or external firms involved; specific jurisdictions were not detailed. He also contributed to the ongoing and highly confidential \\\"sausagefactory.com / Cumberland sausage brigade,\\\" updated on November 15, 2025, a precedent-setting domestic case in Israel concerning Cumberland sausage in a McMuffin, led by Bob Hope (Industrial Legal, London). Another Chambers submission was for \\\"The Sandwich Shop dot com,\\\" also known as \\\"MG Diligence on Island Expansion,\\\" a non-confidential, publishable, precedent-setting cross-border matter between the UK and Ireland focused on market entry and property acquisition in Dublin and Cork. This project commenced on June 7, 2025, and concluded on November 14, 2025, with its financial value increasing from \u00a3700 to \u00a31,200. Jenny Crosby (Property & Tax, Dublin) was the lead lawyer, assisted by Fred Jones (Real Estate, Cork). Andy provided HR and employment advice for \\\"Brewdog,\\\" a new, publishable, precedent-setting domestic UK matter valued at \u00a3400,000, where he personally led efforts to minimize negative press from multiple location closures due to profit concerns. He was also the lead lawyer for the \\\"Coca-Cola promotion campaign,\\\" an existing, non-confidential, publishable cross-border matter between the UK and India, valued at USD 1 million, which ran from March 2021 to September 2021, focusing on analyzing the legitimacy of funds. His portfolio further includes a \u00a32 million UK \\\"Royal Mail restructuring deal\\\" and representing Britvic in the \\\"fizzy drinks scandal.\\\" Andy initiated a separate discussion for \\\"Brown Square Limited\\\" for a Chambers submission but ultimately cancelled the task. The common currencies observed across Andy's matters are Pound Sterling (\u00a3), with instances of USD and Euros.\",\"clients\":\"Mars Chocolate, Mars, Wrigley, Argos Limited, Brewdog, Coca-Cola, Royal Mail, Britvic, The Sandwich Shop dot com, sausagefactory.com, Brown Square Limited\",\"matters\":\"Mars Chocolate restructuring, Mars Chocolate \\\"Cumulus\\\" IP case, Mars acquisition of Wrigley, Brewdog HR/employment advice, Royal Mail restructuring deal, Coca-Cola promotion campaign, HMRC Argos Limited, Britvic fizzy drinks scandal, The Sandwich Shop dot com / MG Diligence on Island Expansion, sausagefactory.com / Cumberland sausage brigade, Brown Square Limited (cancelled)\"}", "is_error": false}}

Published
Understood. What is the client's name? If it's confidential, please give me a general description like 'a leading European bank' or 'a major technology company'.
It's Nivea
Let me quickly look up what kind of company Nivea is to ensure I categorize this correctly.

transcript.message: changing all of their marketing to say that they no longer had any dealings with animal testing

We were just external counsel to check that the marketing position was correct

In the past 12 months we completed a bunch of different elements. One of the main ones was actually to make sure that we could basically make them bulletproof from a litigation point of view.
Why was this matter particularly important to your client, your firm, or the broader legal market? Was it precedent-setting?
Yeah, it was precedent setting. It was also very interesting because it was just UK. That's where they're trying it first.

Let me make sure I've captured this correctly. Your team's work on this matter over the past 12 months focused on ensuring Nivea's marketing claims regarding the absence of animal testing were "bulletproof" from a litigation perspective. This was a precedent-setting...

Your team's work on this matter over the past 12 months focused on ensuring Nivea's marketing claims regarding the absence of animal testing were "bulletproof" from a litigation perspective. This was a precedent-setting initiative, particularly important as it was initially trialed in the UK market. Does that sound right?

transcript.message: Yeah.

Correct.

analysis.transcript_summary: Andy discussed a new, publishable matter for client Nivea. The matter involved ensuring Nivea's marketing claims about no animal testing were litigation-proof in the UK. The value was £75,000. Andy Batty (IP, London) led the matter, which ran from Jan 1, 2021, to Feb 1, 2021. There was no press coverage or other firms involved. Andy confirmed the details were correct.
